result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason L Gardner

defendant.name: Gardner, Jason L
defendant.address: C/o Door County Jail, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: State's response to DOC clarification letter
from DOC requesting clarification on Count 1. Per Court, amend both to 2 years.

Defendant Jason L Gardner in court with attorney Charles Donald Wingrove. Defendant Jason L Gardner in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Counts 3, 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (not joint). Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases

State's Exhibit 1 - Certified bond from case no. 13-CF-6
Exh. 2 - report done by Sgt. Haugard
Exh. 3 - SBPD incident report by Sgt. Waterstreet dated 7/20/14
Exh. 4 - SBPD incident report by Sgt. Waterstreet dated 7/28/14
Exh. 5 - copy of temporary restraining order
All exhibits offered and received.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  This file will track 14-CF-90.  Bond remains as is.

Defendant Jason L Gardner in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Jason L Gardner in custody.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Testimony taken from Sgt. Carl Waterstreet, sworn. Court finds probable cause, binds Defendant over for trial.
No contact direct or indirect with JF.
